document_metadata.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: We used the tau P301S variant, an autosomal dominant mutation that causes early onset FTD with high penetrance (Bugiani et al., 1999; Guo et al., 2017)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: After extensive washing, monomeric and aggregated tau-Dylight were both detected within cells expressing the neuron-specific microtubule-associated protein MAP2, confirming that both forms of tau enter neurons

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Tau-Dylight was found predominantly within the somatic compartment of neurons (Figure 1A)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: After a 4-hr incubation with extracellular tau, flow cytometry analysis (Figures 1B and 1C) revealed that 83% and 73% of dissociated cells contained monomeric or aggregated tau-Dylight, respectively, demonstrating that extracellular tau efficiently enters human neurons in culture

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Internalization of monomeric tau (P301S) and wild-type tau was comparable and concentration dependent (Figure S3A), confirming that the P301S mutation does not confer the ability to efficiently enter neurons, nor is this form of tau likely to aggregate in extracellular media during the 3- to 4-hr incubation period

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Incubation of tau-pHrodo with human neurons at a range of concentrations from 2.5 to 25 nM (0.12â1.2 Âµg.mL-1, diluted in culture medium) showed that tau entry to neurons is rapid, as visualized by live imaging

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: We found that FLAG-tagged tau enters neurons efficiently and that internalized tau persists at detectable levels within neurons for at least 4 days (Figure S4A)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Intracellular fluorescent punctae were observed within the first 10 min of exposure of neurons to monomeric tau-pHrodo (Figure 2A; Video S1). Tau-pHrodo-positive structures increased in size and intensity over the 4-hr course of the assay. These structures were present within neurites and accumulated in the cell bodies of neurons

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: In the presence of 15 and 25 nM monomeric tau-pHrodo, the number of tau-pHrodo-positive objects approached a plateau (>90% of final measurement) after approximately 1 hr (Figure 2C)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: These kinetics of aggregated tau-pHrodo entry are similar to that of both lower concentrations of monomeric tau (2.5 nM) and of low-molecular weight (10-kDa) dextran-pHrodo (same molarity as monomeric tau samples; Figures S5AâS5C

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: In agreement with the monomeric tau-pHrodo experiments, monomeric tau-Dylight was rapidly taken up into neurons (Figure 3C

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: As early as 1 hr after the addition of extracellular tau, monomeric and aggregated tau-Dylight were co-localized in EEA1+ early endosomes

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Monomeric and aggregated tau-Dylight were also detected in LAMP1+late endosomes and lysosomes, consistent with endocytosed proteins first reaching early endosomes, before late endosomes and lysosomes

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Thus, monomeric and aggregated tau both efficiently enter neurons via the endosome/lysosome system, and they are actively trafficked within vesicles over long distances within neurons over several hours

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Monomeric and aggregated tau-Dylight were also detected in LAMP1+late endosomes and lysosomes, consistent with endocytosed proteins first reaching early endosomes, before late endosomes and lysosomes

links.evidence: Thus, monomeric and aggregated tau both efficiently enter neurons via the endosome/lysosome system, and they are actively trafficked within vesicles over long distances within neurons over several hours

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Thus, monomeric and aggregated tau both efficiently enter neurons via the endosome/lysosome system, and they are actively trafficked within vesicles over long distances within neurons over several hours

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Thus, monomeric and aggregated tau both efficiently enter neurons via the endosome/lysosome system, and they are actively trafficked within vesicles over long distances within neurons over several hours

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: These data indicate that, at the concentrations studied, aggregated tau enters neurons almost entirely via endocytosis

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: The amount of monomeric tau entering neurons, as measured by total fluorescent intensity of intracellular monomeric tau-pHrodo vesicles, was significantly reduced by dynamin inhibition, as shown at 1 and 3 hr after the addition of extracellular tau (Figure 4B)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: The effect of dynamin inhibition on the entry of aggregated tau was more pronounced than on monomeric tau (Figures 4Dâ4F). The total fluorescent intensity of intracellular aggregated taupHrodo was consistently reduced by more than 70% at 1 and 3 hr after tau addition (Figure 4E), and the number of taupHrodo- positive objects was reduced by 95% (Figure 4F)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Conversely, dynamin inhibition significantly reduced the entry of aggregated tau, with no significant effects of Cytochalasin D (Figure S6) at this relatively high molar concent of aggregated tau

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: The amount of monomeric tau entering neurons, as measured by total fluorescent intensity of intracellular monomeric tau-pHrodo vesicles, was significantly reduced by dynamin inhibition, as shown at 1 and 3 hr after the addition of extracellular tau (Figure 4B)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: The effect of dynamin inhibition on the entry of aggregated tau was more pronounced than on monomeric tau (Figures 4Dâ4F). The total fluorescent intensity of intracellular aggregated taupHrodo was consistently reduced by more than 70% at 1 and 3 hr after tau addition (Figure 4E), and the number of taupHrodo- positive objects was reduced by 95% (Figure 4F)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Conversely, dynamin inhibition significantly reduced the entry of aggregated tau, with no significant effects of Cytochalasin D (Figure S6) at this relatively high molar concent of aggregated tau

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Inhibition of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D disrupts several clathrin-independent endocytic processes, including bulk endocytosis/ macropinocytosis (Mooren et al., 2012)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Inhibition of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D disrupts several clathrin-independent endocytic processes, including bulk endocytosis/ macropinocytosis (Mooren et al., 2012)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Inhibition of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D disrupts several clathrin-independent endocytic processes, including bulk endocytosis/ macropinocytosis (Mooren et al., 2012)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Entry of monomeric tau was markedly reduced in the presence of 1 mM Cytochalasin D, as reflected in the 95% reduction in the number of monomeric tau-pHrodo-positive objects after 3-hr incubation in the presence of 1 mMCytochalasinD (Figure 5C)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: In contrast, disruption of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D had little effect on the entry of aggregated tau (total fluorescent intensity and number of objects; Figures 5Dâ5F; Figure S5)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Conversely, dynamin inhibition significantly reduced the entry of aggregated tau, with no significant effects of Cytochalasin D (Figure S6) at this relatively high molar concent of aggregated tau

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Inhibition of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D disrupts several clathrin-independent endocytic processes, including bulk endocytosis/ macropinocytosis (Mooren et al., 2012)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Inhibition of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D disrupts several clathrin-independent endocytic processes, including bulk endocytosis/ macropinocytosis (Mooren et al., 2012)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Disruption of actin polymerization has previously been shown to inhibit entry of fibrils formed of the tau repeat domain (Holmes et al., 2013)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Inhibition of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D disrupts several clathrin-independent endocytic processes, including bulk endocytosis/ macropinocytosis (Mooren et al., 2012)

links.evidence: Inhibition of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D disrupts several clathrin-independent endocytic processes, including bulk endocytosis/ macropinocytosis (Mooren et al., 2012)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Inhibition of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D disrupts several clathrin-independent endocytic processes, including bulk endocytosis/ macropinocytosis (Mooren et al., 2012)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: Inhibition of actin polymerization with Cytochalasin D disrupts several clathrin-independent endocytic processes, including bulk endocytosis/ macropinocytosis (Mooren et al., 2012)

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: These independent assays confirmed the same differential effects of the two inhibitors observed by live imaging of pHrodo-tau: at the 3-hr assay point, dynamin inhibition had no effect on the number of monomeric tau-Dylightpositive punctae within neurons, whereas inhibition of actin polymerization reduced the amount of intracellular tau by over half (Figure S6).

citation.name: Extracellular Monomeric and Aggregated Tau Efficiently Enter Human Neurons through Overlapping but Distinct Pathways.

links.evidence: These independent assays confirmed the same differential effects of the two inhibitors observed by live imaging of pHrodo-tau: at the 3-hr assay point, dynamin inhibition had no effect on the number of monomeric tau-Dylightpositive punctae within neurons, whereas inhibition of actin polymerization reduced the amount of intracellular tau by over half (Figure S6).
